channel.title: Separate workstations vs separate snapshots
channel.description:
For better security and anonymity Whonix documentation suggests [using separate workstations](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Multiple_Whonix-Workstations). Why are snapshots not mentioned at all? You could have different and fully separate snapshots of the same VM and you could maintain them separately for the duration of their lifespan. Would that be any worse than using whole separate workstations? Would it make a difference if the snapshots were created i.e. separated when Whonix ran for the first time or when the Workstation VM would have already been in use for a while and would not be in the same state as in the beginning?
Snapshots could be simpler and take up less disk space

item.title: Separate workstations vs separate snapshots
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
clockworld:

For better security and anonymity Whonix documentation suggests using separate workstations. Why are snapshots not mentioned at all?

Perhaps not on this page but I remember writing this advice elsewhere.

clockworld:

Would that be any worse than using whole separate workstations?

Only downside is you won’t be able to multi-task activities with different sec levels.

clockworld:

Would it make a difference if the snapshots were created i.e. separated when Whonix ran for the first time or when the Workstation VM would have already been in use for a while and would not be in the same state as in the beginning?

Yes because you can’t guarantee that no identifiers or malware is present after use. My advice is to take a snapshot after updating and customizing the software selection locally before doing anything.

clockworld:

Snapshots could be simpler and take up less disk space

Same as above.

item.title: Separate workstations vs separate snapshots
item.dc:creator: Goldstein
item.description:
clockworld:

Would it make a difference if the snapshots were created i.e. separated when Whonix ran for the first time or when the Workstation VM would have already been in use for a while and would not be in the same state as in the beginning?

Yes it would make a difference, if for example your Workstation VM gets somehow compromised/leaks (by a User Error/a 0Day/a Malicious File/etc) before you create the Snapshot then you end up with two bad Workstations.

It’s not worth it to sacrifice security (even if its only a small decrease) for disk space IMHO
